classes.cCustomNote: Select one course from the following: ANT201; GEOG150; HIST110, HIST111, HIST222, HIST223.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), B1-B5 elective, C1, C2, C3, C4, D2, D3, D4, D5, and F. C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). One (1) course must be selected from B1, in addition to STAT217. No POLS class may be taken to fulfill GE D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D3, D4, D5, or F.

USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D3, D4, D5, or F.

Any POLS Major Course (300-400 level elective) can go here. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward upper division Political Science electives. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count towards the concentration. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward Free Electives. Any combination of POLS386 and POLS387 may be taken for a maximum of 12 units total credit for the degree.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.

Select two of the following: BUS207, BUS409, BUS410, BUS473; CRP/NR 404; ES380; JOUR302; LS214; PHIL334; POLS295, POLS340, POLS342, POLS384, POLS386 or POLS387 (4 units max), POLS417, POLS426, POLS445, POLS457; PSY375; SOC402, SOC406, SOC412.

A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward upper division Political Science electives. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count towards the concentration. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward Free Electives. Any combination of POLS 386 and POLS387 may be taken for a maximum of 12 units total credit for the degree.

Consultation with a faculty advisor is recommended prior to selecting Approved Electives; bear in mind your selections may impact pursuit of post-baccalaureate plans and/or goals.
